derivation.yuyuan_name: late 16th cent.: from Latin notatio(n-), from the verb notare, from nota 'mark'

entry.tran: (音乐、数学等的)标记系统，成套符号
entry.def: A system of notation is a set of written symbols that are used to represent something such as music or mathematics.

example.ex: Musical notation was conceived for the C major scale and each line and space represents a note in this scale.
example.tran: 五线谱以C大音阶构成，每一个线和间代表这个音阶的音符。

example.ex: ...some other abstract notation system like a computer language.
example.tran: 其他的抽象符号系统，如计算机语言

means.word_mean: 1. a technical system of symbols used to represent special things

sentences.sentence: "his notes were appended at the end of the article"
"he added a short notation to the address on the envelope"

means.word_mean: 3. the activity of representing something by a special system of marks or characters
